intro: Aciotis herbacea, commonly known as the slender aciotis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it has hairy, narrow leaves. Aciotis herbacea is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
